name: 'Angel Maintenance' Trivia Game | 'West Wing' - Season 4 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What word did Josh tell Donna she misspelled?
questions.explanation:
gear.

	When Josh left the Roosevelt room, he told Donna, "No, you wrote, 'They're having a problem with their landing geak.'"

questions.text: Who asked Leo about the foam for the runway?
questions.explanation:
Margaret.

	After Leo told Margaret about the flame retardant foam, Margaret asked him, "But it's not impact-retardant, though, is it?

questions.text: Who found information about Air Force One to brief CJ?
questions.explanation:
Donna.

	Josh gave Donna the job because she wanted to do more.

questions.text: According to the pilot, it would take the F-16's from Durbin Air Force Base 22 minutes to get to Air Force One.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The Colonel gave the President this information while he was on the phone with Leo.

questions.text: How much did the indicator light switch cost?
questions.explanation:
30 cents.

	Leo told Jed how much the piece cost.

questions.text: Who sent Will to the Philippines in their place?
questions.explanation:
Toby & Toby Ziegler & Tobias.

	In Leo's doorway, Toby told Josh, "Thank God I sent Will in my place." Later, he told Josh he didn't mean for that to sound like he knew the plane was going to go down and that's why he was glad Will went.

questions.text: Who screamed, "I want this plane to land"?
questions.explanation:
Jed.

	Will looked out the window and asked, "Did it work?"

questions.text: How many men were killed in Kundu during a friendly fire exercise?
questions.explanation:
Five.

	There was a GPS error, as Leo explained it, and five soldiers were in the spot that was fired upon.

questions.text: Did Josh tell Donna that Air Force One is called Angel?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Donna gave Josh the information and he couldn't believe he didn't know it.

questions.text: At the end of the episode, how long had Air Force One been in the air on the return trip home?
questions.explanation:
22 hours 13 minutes.

	The pilot announced over the intercom that they had been in the air on the return trip home for 22 hours and 13 minutes. He also said that there had been 3 separate crews flying the plane, one engagement, a birthday, 3 pieces of legislation had been passed and Colombia had been re-certified as an ally against drugs.
